title: (x) FREEDOM - flared, pen-like serif face - ITC Tiepolo {Yves}
content:
I’m sure I should know this, but hey, it’s Friday morning and I seem to have left my brain at home.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [FREEDOM.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107033455/http:/typophile.com/files/FREEDOM.jpg) | 21.5 KB |

 [‹ (x) "gHaneal" flare serif logo - ITC Benguiat {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107033455/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12590 "Go to previous forum topic") [3d Architectural lettering ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107033455/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12528 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Richard Hards

comments.content: Stretching [Arthur Baker](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107033455/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Arthur%252BBaker) and [Cynthia Hollandsworth](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107033455/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Cynthia%252BHollandsworth)’s [ITC Tiepolo Black italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107033455/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=C.6904.0.6&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=FREEDOM&sampleSize=48) will get you there.

It certainly will, 150% horizontal scale, -11 tracking and a little kerning either side of the O to be precise!

Thanks Yves
BTW I’ve got mine with me but it appears to be working in shifts... :-D
